messages.subject: Re: Parents dying and stupid people comments
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/23/2002 8:42:56 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Pam, I m so sorry... It s so hard adjusting to the loss of a parent, and it must be even
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/23/2002 8:42:56 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> My mother died, suddenly, a few weeks ago. You cannot IMAGINE the idiotic
> things people say at funeral services. Sometimes they were so odd that they
>
> were laughable. Someone said, "Your mother would be so happy to see her
> children all here together." HUH? At her funeral? (My sisters and I are
> close and spend a LOT of time together - we live really close and we hang
> out together constantly - so it isn't like this was unusual or anything.)
>
>

Pam, I'm so sorry...
It's so hard adjusting to the loss of a parent, and it must be even harder
when it happens suddenly. If you want to e-mail, please do...we seem to be
going through a similar thing at the same time.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
